item.title: Securely using passwords with R
item.description: It is quite common to have code that needs to interact with another system, database, or third party application, and need to use some sort of credentials to securely communicate. Most of the code I wrote in R, or reviewed, had normally no borders (from a system analysis perspective) with other systems, or basically just interacted with the file system to retrieve NetCDF or JSON files. However, after I saw a comment in Reddit [1] some time ago about this, I decided to check what others used.

item.title: Treemapping Jenkins Extension Points with R
item.description:
I have been playing with R and its packages for some time, and decided to study it a bit harder. Last week I started reading the Advanced R Programming by Hadley Wickham.

One of the first chapters talks about the basic data structures in R. In order to get my feet wet I thought about a simple example: treemapping Jenkins extension points.
